result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie Rydell King Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber release for work, school and treatment.  No release to DRC or electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnie Rydell King Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).      Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements by: Tiesha D.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  No release to DRC or electronic monitoring. 

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Defendant appears this a.m. and was taken into custody.  Later same day, case called on the record.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King not in court.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Case before the court on a Justice Point Discharge Summary.   Notice of Hearing was provided to all parties; defendant failed to appear.  For both reasons, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.
Status conference on June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Court set hearing for 6-26-2014 to address violation report.  Notice sent to all parties.    lfc
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Hanna R Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26. Court VACATED Jury Trial set for 06-16-2014.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.  Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed with court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with court.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Filed by the State:  Witness List, Motion in Limine, Requested Jury Instructions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present caseworker Chelsee Bates.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Justice Point report addressed.  Defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.  Defendant admonished regarding his drug use.  Court does not modify bail at this time.  Case remains set for final pretrial on 6-4-14 and jury trial on 6-16-14.  Justice point monitoring modified to ENHANCED supervision.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Danielle L. Shelton.  Paul Hauer for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/24/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Ronnie Rydell King in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
